entry.title: Bitcoind-in-background mode for SPV wallets
entry.summary: On April 10, 2014, Gregory Maxwell suggested the idea of coding the entire blockchain with an error-correcting code so that it wouldn't matter which subset one is holding. He also questioned whether new blocks could be added to the chain with the encoding incrementally. The message was signed using PGP (Pretty Good Privacy), a cryptographic software that provides encryption and authentication for electronic communications.
